intro: Acer fabri var. virescens, commonly known as the Variegated Maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its striking variegated leaves that display a mix of green, white, and pink hues. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a rounded, compact shape. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. The bark is smooth and light gray, becoming fissured with age.
